RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui mestrado em Geociкncias na Universitа degli Studi di Trieste, Itбlia (2012). Desde marзo de 2018 tem doutorado pela Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto (MG, Brasil) a partir de outubro de 2013. Desde novembro de 2018 tem pуs-doutorado no Instituto de Astronomia, Geofнsica e Ciкncias Ambientais da Universidade de Sгo Paulo (SP, Brasil). com projeto de oxidaзгo da atmosfera e dos oceanos durante dois grandes perнodos de transiзгo, o Grande Evento de Oxidaзгo (~ 2.45 e 2.2 Ga) e o Evento de Oxidaзгo Neoproterozуico (~ 0.80 e 0.54 Ga). Tem experiкncia em geoquнmica, geocronologia, petrologia clбssica e experimental. Os estudos enfocam principalmente os seguintes tуpicos: geocronologia de sedimentos e geoquнmica isotуpica relacionados aos perнodos de oxidaзгo da Terra, geoquнmica e geocronologia de minerais acessуrios pelo estudo de magmas fйlsicos a ultramбficos, petrologia experimental para estudar a (s) fonte (s) de granitos e magmas em geral; geologia e geodinвmica da transiзгo Arqueano-Paleoproterozуico, Neoproterozуico e Triбssico Mйdio. Juntamente com esses projetos, outros que estгo sendo desenvolvidos sгo: xenуlitos de manto e corpos peridotнticos, geraзгo de basaltos alcalinos e ultra-alcalinos. Emfim, ele estб interessado em estudar o magmatismo ultramбfico arqueano komatiнtico.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Has a master's degree in Geosciences at the Universitа degli Studi di Trieste, Italy (2012). Since March 2018 has a doctorate from the Federal University of Ouro Preto (MG, Brazil) beginning in October 2013. Since November 2018 has a postdoctorate at the Institute of Astronomy, Geophysics and Environmental Sciences of the University of Sгo Paulo (SP, Brazil) with project on oxidation of the atmosphere and oceans during two major transitional periods, the Great Oxidation Event (~ 2.45 and 2.2 Ga) and the Neoproterozoic Oxidation Event (~ 0.80 and 0.54 Ga). Has experience in geochemistry, geochronology, classical and experimental petrology. Studies focus mainly on the following topics: sediment geochronology and isotopic geochemistry related to Earth oxidation periods, geochemistry and geochronology of accessory minerals by the study of felsic to ultramafic magmas, experimental petrology to study the source (s) of granites and magmas in general; geology and geodynamics of the Archean-Paleoproterozoic, Neoproterozoic and Triassic Medium transition. Along with these projects, others that are being developed are: mantle xenoliths and peridotitic bodies, generation of alkali and ultra-alkaline basalts. Finally, he is interested in studying Komatiitic Archean ultramafic magmatism.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Estudo geoquнmico e petrolуgico dos granitos cordileiranos prй-colisionais (Suнte Galilйia) do Orogeno Araзuaн. O assunto do estudo refere-se ao entendimento da gкnese e a fonte desses granitos: produzidos pela mistura de magmas mбficos derivados do mantos com magmas de origem crustal, ou a fonte й exclusivamente crustal? Para isto serгo estudados minerais acessуrios como zircгo, titanita, granada e epidoto.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Geochemical and petrological study of the pre-collisional cordilleran-type granitoids (Galilйia suite) of the Araзuaн orogen. The main object is to understand which is the genesis and source(s) of these granitoids: are these produced from a mixing between mafic-mantle derived and crustally derived magmas or are directly produced by the partial melting of and (meta)igneous rock? In order to answer to these questions, the more powerful accessory minerals such as zircon, titanite, garnet, and epidote will be investigated.

Para isto serгo estudados minerais acessуrios como zircгo, titanita, granada e epidoto.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Geochemical and petrological study of the pre-collisional cordilleran-type granitoids (Galilйia suite) of the Araзuaн orogen. The main object is to understand which is the genesis and source(s) of these granitoids: are these produced from a mixing between mafic-mantle derived and crustally derived magmas or are directly produced by the partial melting of and (meta)igneous rock? In order to answer to these questions, the more powerful accessory minerals such as zircon, titanite, garnet, and epidote will be investigated.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Limites temporais, condiзхes de oxi-reduзгo e fontes dos sedimentos relacionados ao aumento na oxygкnaзгo atmosfйrica no Proterozoico no Brasil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A atmosfera e os oceanos se tornaram oxidados em dois perнodos de transiзгo principais, o Grande Evento de Oxidaзгo (~ 2.45 e 2.2 Ga) e o Evento de Oxidaзгo Neoproterozуico (~ 0.80 e 0.54 Ga). Evidкncias sгo encontradas na Бfrica do Sul, Amйrica do Norte, Austrбlia Ocidental e Rъssia. Porйm, o tempo real, duraзгo, mecanismo e alcance do aumento de O2 ainda sгo questхes abertas devido a pobreza nas idades e as contradiзхes nas correlaзхes estratigrбficas entre esses diferentes terrenos. Curiosamente, vбrios estudos enfatizaram uma possнvel relaзгo entre eventos de oxidaзгo, eventos de glaciaзгo global coevos e ampla atividade de grandes provнncias нgneas. No Brasil, rochas sedimentares que pertenciam as Provнncias Paleoproterozуicas de Carajбs e do Quadrilatero Ferrifero e aos Grupos Neoproterozуicos do Jacadigo e do Bambuн foram depositadas durante os Eventos de Oxidaзгo Grande e Neoproterozуico, respectivamente. Apesar disso, eles nгo sгo considerados na reconstruзгo global por causa de uma investigaзгo geocronolуgica, elementar e isotуpica ainda escassa. Isso impхe uma caracterizaзгo mais aprofundada. O objetivo deste projeto й, portanto: i) constranger a idades dos Eventos de Oxidaзгo Grande e Neoproterozуico e os episуdios glaciais associados por meio da geocronologia Re-Os em xistos negros e sulfetos sedimentares de unidades sedimentares chave do Brasil; ii) realizar a sistemбtica isotуpica de Nd - Hf nos mesmos sedimentos datados, em diamictitos glaciais e em carbonatos relacionados, do Brasil, e seus equivalentes do Oeste da Austrбlia (Grupo do Turee Creek) para caracterizar as fontes de sedimentos e avaliar o papel potencial das grandes provнncias нgneas na oxigenaзгo e resfriamento global da superfнcie da Terra durante o Proterozуico.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The atmosphere and oceans became oxidized across two main transitional periods, the Great Oxidation Event (~2.45 and 2.2 Ga) and the Neoproterozoic Oxidation Event (~0.80 and 0.54 Ga). Pieces of evidence are found in South Africa, North America, Western Australia and Russia, but the real timing, duration, mechanism and range of O2 increase are still unsolved question due to poor age constraints and contradictory stratigraphic correlations between these different terrains. Intriguingly, several studies have emphasized a possible causal relationship between oxidation events, coeval global glaciation events and widespread activity of subaerial large igneous provinces. In Brazil, sedimentary rocks of the Paleoproterozoic Carajбs and Quadrilatero Ferrifero Mineral Provinces, and the Neoproterozoic Jacadigo and Bambuн Groups were deposited during the Great and Neoproterozoic Events, respectively. Nevertheless, they are not considered in global reconstruction because of a still scanty geochronological, elemental and isotopic investigation. This imposes a deepened characterization. The aim of this project is, therefore: i) to constrain the timing of the Great and Neoproterozoic Oxidation Events, and associated glacial episodes through Re-Os geochronology of black shales and sedimentary sulphides of key sedimentary units from Brazil; ii) to perform Nd - Hf isotope systematics on the same organic-rich sediments, glacial diamictites and related carbonates from Brazil and their equivalent from Western Australia (Turee Creek Group) in order to characterize sediment sources and evaluate the potential role of Large Igneous Province in the oxygenation and global cooling of the Erath surface during the Proterozoic.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Time constraints, redox conditions and sediment sources attending the Proterozoic rise of atmospheric oxygen in Brazil

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Extreme U-Pb zircon age variability in the lower crustal Galilйia Batholith (SE Brazil)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The garnet-epidote-bearing cordilleran-type Galilйia Batholith (30000 km2) appears to have been assembled in the lower crust (> 0.8 GPa) between ca. 630 and ca. 570 Ma [1]. New U-Pb zircon LA-ICP-MS dating on metaluminous to peraluminous granitoids from the batholith disclose an intriguingly long potential crystallization history, that is consistent with the proposed >10kbar crystallisation indicated by the mineralogy and mineral chemistry of the rocks [1]. In most cases, the scatter of U-Pb zircon dates from a single sample cannot be explained by analytical uncertainties alone, yielding weighted mean dates with considerable over-dispersion (MSWD >> 1). In individual samples, the ages of oscillatory zoned, magmatic zircon, appears to record between ca. 20 to 50 Myrs of crystallisation suggesting extremely protracted zircon crystallisation. Hf isotopic compositions of the same zircon crystals show negative values, with εHf from -6 up to -16, and scattered behaviour, varying from 4 up to 10 εHf units per sample. Zircon ages and εHf are correlated, with εHf decreasing in young crystals, while zircon Th/U ratios appear to increase through time. The rare occurrence of dissolution textures in zircon suggest that the magma was kept near Zr-saturation for ca. 50 Myr. Collectively, these data suggest that the Galilйia batholith was incrementally assembled over an extended period of time in a magmatic system that became progressively less radiogenic in Hf and enriched in Th. Overall, this might have been assisted by the fact that the Galilйia Batholith was emplaced in the lower crust, as indicated by the coexistence of garnet, epidote and phengite in some samples. [1] Narduzzi et al. (2017) Lithos 282-283, 82-97.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: From high (> 0.8 GPa) to low (ca. 0.5 GPa) pressure crystallization: evidence from the grossular-rich magmatic garnets of the Galilйia Batholith, Brazil
